contentfulPage.title: Plank 1: Protect communities with a new paradigm for public safety beyond policing

pageListingInfo.title: Create a new paradigm for public safety and shrink the footprint of policing

description.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"We must ensure a new paradigm for public safety emphasizes non-carceral interventions and programs, not jails and prisons, to keep communities safe. detailPageTitle.pageHeadline: Protect communities with a new paradigm for public safety beyond policing

richText.raw: {"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"heading-3","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Public safety is served when all people feel safe and are safe in their communities. ","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"paragraph","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"But the nation’s current approach to public safety does the opposite: It endangers people and communities. The current system of policing and criminalization is one that has disproportionately targeted communities of color, beginning with slave patrols and continuing with modern-day policing practices, including brutal suppression of social justice, labor, and protest movements. Tactics like “stop and frisk,” police killings of Black people with impunity, police presence in schools that predominantly serve students of color, and disproportionate enforcement of drug laws against people of color all perpetuate this crisis.  ","marks":[],"data":{}}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"paragraph","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"To ensure all people can feel safe and be safe, we must end this racist and classist system of criminalization and build a system premised on actual safety and genuine accountability. Advancing a new paradigm for public safety requires rethinking the purpose and amount of resources that we give to punitive-, arrest-, and surveillance-focused activities. It also requires ending the discriminatory policies and practices that enable systemic abuses against Black, Brown, Native, low-income, and other communities. Because police departments receive so much funding and resources, less funding is available for the social supports and infrastructure that enable communities to be safe and thrive. Devoting more resources to providing these necessities — high-quality health services, well-resourced schools, good-paying jobs, affordable housing — is what keeps communities safe. ","marks":[],"data":{}}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"paragraph","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Real safety is located not in carceral institutions, but in rebalancing spending and meeting the needs of communities — especially Black, Brown, Native, and low-income communities — that have gone unmet for decades. It’s time to build new systems premised on real safety and accountability.","marks":[],"data":{}}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"paragraph","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Read our policy recommendations.","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":" ","marks":[],"data":{}}],"data":{}}]}

content.raw: {"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"heading-4","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Create new, non-carceral systems to manage crises — including crises related to mental health, substance use, and disability — and to address traffic enforcement without involving police. Mandate collection and public reporting of data surrounding all police-community interactions.","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"paragraph","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"","marks":[],"data":{}}],"data":{}}]}

{"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"heading-4","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Eliminate federal, state, and local laws that shield police officers from accountability, including qualified immunity and secrecy laws, and change policy and police practices to ensure accountability by creating a national “necessary” standard for when force can be used.","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}}]}]}

{"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"heading-4","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Prohibit police from practices and tools that have a disparate impact on marginalized communities, including SWAT raids, predictive policing technologies, consent searches, and civil asset forfeiture.","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"paragraph","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"","marks":[],"data":{}}],"data":{}}]}
